snippet: The owner of a Long Island restaurant, who is accused of selling striped bass without following strict regulations, says he serves his own catch to his friends and employees.
abstract: Frank Genovas, owner of Francesco's diner in Babylon, NY, is cited for four misdemeanor-level violations for illegally serving striped bass at his restaurant; Genovas says he serves his own catch to his friends and employees, and that such use is not in violation of restrictions on striped bass fishing.
lead_paragraph: The owner of a Long Island restaurant, who is accused of selling striped bass without following strict regulations, says he serves his own catch to his friends and employees.

headline.main: Restaurant Is Accused of Selling Bass Illegally
headline.print_headline: Restaurant Is Accused Of Selling Bass Illegally
